main_definition: Relating to sound or the sense of hearing, especially as it pertains to music.

meanings_and_examples.example: An acoustic guitar performance at a small venue.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to the properties and phenomena of sound waves
meanings_and_examples.example: The acoustics of a concert hall can greatly affect how music is heard by an audience.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Pertaining to or produced using only natural sounds, as opposed to electronic effects
meanings_and_examples.example: An acoustic version of a song typically includes only vocals and the instruments being played live without additional audio processing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Concerned with sound quality and its perception by human ears
meanings_and_examples.example: Acoustic engineers design spaces to improve their acoustics for better sound quality.
